g.text: to know broker to connect to)
in the group gets a message
restricts only one consumer per partition
partition can be written as several
WAL segment files of fixed size, new file
is started as current reaches a size
or new consumer added or consumer leaves all
will get "rejoin" response on their heartbeats
In-sync replicas - IRS (brokers not far behind)
will be in-sync once caught up
Message can be lost before storage, or while consumed
Message can be delivered/consumed multiple times, with dups
* ACK=all (wait for all IRS to ack, before ack to producer)
* ACK=1 (once stored on main/leader for partition, producer is acked)
ACK=1 may loose message (if leader dies before replication)
1. delayed messages (need separate storage) + trigger to main queue (e.g. using dedicated delay queues for 1m,5m,1h, etc)
2. retry topics (messages that failed to be consumed)
3. Keep historical data in HDFS or object store (to replay messages, since WAL is truncated after messages are consumed/acked)
